headline: Apollo Commercial Real Estate Finance, Inc. Declares Quarterly Common Stock Dividend
summary: NEW YORK, Sept. 09, 2025 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- Apollo Commercial Real Estate Finance, Inc. (the “Company”) (NYSE:ARI) today announced the Board of Directors declared a dividend of $0.25 per share of common stock, which is payable on October 15, 2025 to common stockholders of record on September 30, 2025. headline: Apollo’s Zelter Predicts ‘Washout’ With Some PE Firms Dissolving
summary: “I don’t expect a massive monetization cycle to hit,” Zelter said Tuesday at the Barclays Global Financial Services Conference.  Since 2022, elevated interest rates have curbed private equity dealmaking and slowed cash distributions to fund investors.

headline: Blackstone’s Private Credit Line to Dropbox Raised to $2.7 Billion
summary: Dropbox increased its leverage by $700 million while authorizing a new $1.5 billion stock buyback plan, a filing and company statement show.  Blackstone first put together a $2 billion private credit loan in December as part of the company’s stock repurchase program.  Dropbox is among a number of public companies that are increasingly turning to direct lenders for easy access to financing.

headline: Why a Fed rate cut might not help the stock market
summary: Markets are nearly certain the Fed will cut interest rates after weak jobs data, but some strategists warn that looser monetary policy could bring new risks for stocks.

headline: TenFifty Capital, a New European CRE Lending Platform, Announces Its Launch
